snippet: Compared with the reaction to a 2010 disaster, the response by Chilean officials to a magnitude-8.2 earthquake Tuesday revealed important shifts in emergency preparation.
abstract: Chilean officials quick response to 8.2 magnitude earthquake, which claimed six lives, illustrates how much country has improved its emergency preparedness methods since 2010 earthquake, in which 525 people died.

byline.original: By PASCALE BONNEFOY and SIMON ROMERO
byline.contributor: Pascale Bonnefoy reported from Santiago, and Simon Romero from Rio de Janeiro.

lead_paragraph: Compared with the reaction to a 2010 disaster, the response by Chilean officials to a magnitude-8.2 earthquake Tuesday revealed important shifts in emergency preparation.

headline.main: Responding to Quake, Chile Uses Lessons of Past
headline.print_headline: Responding to Quake, Chile Uses Lessons of Past
